modal.title: Tour de Babel
modal.text: L'histoire de Tour de Babel  est un mythe d'origine destiné à expliquer pourquoi les peuples du monde parlent des langues différentes.  <0/><0/>Selon l'histoire,une race humaine unie dans les générations après le déluge, parler une seule langue et migrer vers l'est, vient au pays de Shinar. Là, ils acceptent de construire une ville et une tour assez haute pour atteindre le ciel.<0/><0/> Dieu, observant leur ville et leur tour, confond leur parole pour qu'ils ne puissent plus se comprendre, et les disperse dans le monde.

atlas.title: Launch Atlas 0.1
atlas.text: This will be the initial release of our content consumption client, aiming to be considerably more effective than the current Pioneer media experience.

contentDirectory.title: Deploy a new content directory and corresponding working group
contentDirectory.text: We will be modifying the content directory to allow for a new data model for content, supported by new schemas. We will also make some associated improvements to the Content Curator Working Group.

hydraNode.title: Deploy first self-hosted Joystream Hydra node only supporting content directory
hydraNode.text: Further work on our Hydra framework is required in order to support the new content directory.

map.title: Babylon
map.text: <0>Babylon was the capital city of Babylonia, a kingdom in ancient Mesopotamia, almost 4000 years ago.</0> It was built along the left and right banks of the Euphrates river with steep embankments to contain the river's seasonal floods. <1/><1/> The city is considered to be of great historical and cultural importance. The Hanging Gardens of Babylon were one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and Babylon was also purported to be the site of the Tower of Babel.<1/><1/><2><0/> Read the blog post</2>
